definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
Employment Stability Fee (Taiwan), a minimum monthly fee for employing foreign workers

sentences.english: I only brought my passport and the Foreign Employment License.
sentences.chinese: 我只帶了護照和外國人就業證。

sentences.english: To value the employment courses and practical training.
sentences.chinese: 重視就業學程與實作訓練。

sentences.english: Thirdly, to obtain employment successfully, ex-servicemen should bring into play their predominance themselves too.
sentences.chinese: 再者，退役軍人在就業時也應當注意發揮自身優勢。

sentences.english: Similarly a few years know that we are facing employment problems.
sentences.chinese: 同理可知再過幾年我們所面臨的就業問題。

sentences.english: Other factors will affect near-term employment growth as well.
sentences.chinese: 其他因素也會對近期的就業增長產生影響。

sentences.english: Grads get offers in grassroots-level schools teaching in Guangdong.
sentences.chinese: 廣東應屆畢業生獲得農村學校教書的就業機會。

sentences.english: Job growth may also set loose what economists call “shadow demand”.
sentences.chinese: 就業增加也許能刺激經濟學家口中的“影子需求”。

sentences.english: Employment in U.S. furniture factories fell by 60% over the last decade.
sentences.chinese: 過去10年中，美國傢俱廠的就業人數減少了60%。

sentences.english: Graduates usually enter (or reenter) public dentistry practice.
sentences.chinese: 畢業生通常就業於公共牙科醫院。

sentences.english: The first is an opt-out from social and employment legislation.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一步就是部分退出社會與就業相關條例。

sentences.english: There is consider-able pessimism about job opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 人們對就業機會相當悲觀。

sentences.english: Bank scaling up efforts to support the creation of good jobs.
sentences.chinese: 世行正加大工作力度，支持創造好的就業崗位。

sentences.english: The central government will allocate 43.3 billion yuan to stimulate employment;
sentences.chinese: 中央財政擬投入433億元用於促進就業。

sentences.english: After all, we cannot drink poison to quench thirst when it comes to jobs.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，解決就業難的問題，千萬不能飲鴆止渴。

sentences.english: The Enlightenments of the Western Countries' Policies of Promoting Youth Emnlovment on Our Countrv.
sentences.chinese: 第四章是西方國家促進青年就業政策對我國的啓示。

sentences.english: Second, extending unemployment benefits has a negative long-term effect on employment.
sentences.chinese: 第二，延長失業救濟期限對就業存在長期負面影響。

to be employed/to be in post/on-the-job
